info.headline: High Wind Warning issued May 12 at 1:13PM MST until May 13 at 7:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff AZ
info.description:
...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM MST /8 PM MDT/ THIS EVENING...
* WHAT...For the Wind Advisory today, southwest winds 25 to 30 mph with gusts up to 50 mph. For the High Wind Warning Tuesday, southwest winds 30 to 40 mph with gusts from 60 to 70 mph expected.
* WHERE...Little Colorado River Valley.
* WHEN...For the Wind Advisory, until 7 PM MST /8 PM MDT/ this evening. For the High Wind Warning, from 8 AM MST /9 AM MDT/ to 7 PM MST /8 PM MDT/ Tuesday.
* IMPACTS...Damaging winds could blow down some trees and power lines. Travel will be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. Areas of blowing dust will lead to reduced visibilities, resulting in hazardous driving conditions. Gusty winds will blow around unsecured objects.
info.instruction:
Watch for falling debris and tree limbs. Secure loose objects that could be blown around or damaged by the wind.
Winds this strong will make driving extremely difficult, especially for high profile vehicles, such as RVs, campers, and tractor trailers. Use extreme caution and avoid unnecessary travel.

parameter.value: HIGH WIND WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM 8 AM MST /9 AM MDT/ TO 7 PM MST /8 PM MDT/ TUESDAY

area.areaDesc: Little Colorado River Valley in Coconino County; Little Colorado River Valley in Navajo County; Little Colorado River Valley in Apache County
